subject: Timeout taking double the time

messageBody:
Hello,

I'm writing a custom JUnit test runner so that I can run tests in
different processes. THis is necessary for an online grading system in
which we want to ensure that the student has the best chance of
passing each test -- if one test times out, we don't want to abort the
whole process.

When I use the @Test(timeout=...) attribute, it seems to take twice as
long as I specify to run the code. I suspect that the following is the
issue:

boolean terminated= service.awaitTermination(timeout,
TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);
if (!terminated)
service.shutdownNow();
result.get(timeout, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS); // throws the exception
if one occurred during the invocation


If shutdownNow fails to shut things down (as sometimes happens if you
are in a while (true) loop the jvm can't abort), it takes two times
the timeout to get past this code segment. Shouldn't the timeout
passed to result.get be very small?
